messages.content: What happens to my NFT when coverage expires?

Your coverage NFT remains in your wallet, but becomes inactive! 🎫

**After expiration:**
• NFT stays as historical proof
• No longer provides coverage
• Can't be sold (no value)
• Useful for records/auditing

**The NFT shows:**
✅ Original coverage amount
✅ Duration & dates
✅ Premium paid
✅ Whether claims occurred

Think of it like an expired ticket - proof you had coverage, but no longer active. Want to purchase new coverage? 🤖

5. Coverage NFT minted to their wallet!

**No KYC required!** Tonsurance is fully decentralized! 🔓

**To use Tonsurance:**
✅ Just need a TON wallet
✅ No identity verification
✅ No email required
✅ No personal info collected
✅ Global access

**Why no KYC?**
We're a pure DeFi protocol. Coverage contracts are NFTs - anyone can hold them. Payouts execute via smart contracts automatically.

**Privacy:**
Your wallet address is your identity. Fully pseudonymous! 💎

Ready for permissionless coverage? 🤖
What if I lose my wallet?

Your coverage NFT is tied to your wallet, so wallet security is critical! 🔑

**If you lose access:**
❌ Coverage can't be transferred without private key
❌ Payouts would go to that wallet
❌ No way to recover without seed phrase

**Best practices:**
✅ Backup seed phrase securely
✅ Use hardware wallet (Ledger) for large coverage
✅ Consider multi-sig for enterprise coverage
✅ Test small amounts first

**Pro tip:**
For large positions, use a hardware wallet. The coverage NFT stays secure even if your computer is compromised! 🤖
